storyInfo: After witnessing the tragic death of her master, Lyudmila seeks a way to avenge her by taking down Red, but to no avail. In the end, she collapses in exhaustion out in the wilds, and is brought to the Truckers' Union by Sommer, who accidentally passes by.

attributes.text: Old Vasily was a valiant emperor.
Some say that even after the age of eighty, he would don his crown and head to battle.
Ursus had suffered a crushing defeat deep in the snowfields. The bodies were churned into the snow, the corpses piled up into walls.
The emperor screamed bloody vengeance, his anger louder than the howling wind.
The surviving officers surrounded his tent, but the crown shone bright, so bright that the people could only shout their reverence for him.
A sudden fierce gust from the north blew the tent open. Only then did everyone dare to raise their eyes and look ahead.
The crown had fallen on the ground. No longer was there an emperor on the snowfields. It is said that in the end, Old Vasily was trampled to death by the crowd.
Of the countless nameless soldiers kneeling outside his tent, none knew the name of the Slayer of Crowns, or from where they came.

attributes.content: Oh, this is the first time I've heard you tell this story in Siracusan.
attributes.name: Reunion Member

attributes.content: So you got the name 'Crownslayer' out of a book. What's the book called again?
attributes.name: Reunion Member

attributes.content: 'Truth and Justice'.
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: Sounds complicated... I thought books like that were all chunky doorstoppers about big ideas, but you're saying it's a storybook?
attributes.name: Reunion Member

attributes.content: No, it's not. The stories inside aren't for entertainment, but to get people thinking.
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: What is 'truth'? What is 'justice'?
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: Should they be considered the same? Should they be set against each other? Who gets to be the one that defines them? Which side of the scale do we believe we're on?
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: Or maybe they don't exist in any real sense? Just like... Just like how Reunion is over.
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: In the end, the only time they're of any use are when putting together a lovely little list of justifications.
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: Err... Y'know, before you told me this story, all I wanted to ask was where we should head next.
attributes.name: Reunion Member

attributes.content: I was just about to say. This is where we part, friend.
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: If you keep going straight this way, you'll come out of the woods and spot some old nomadic city tracks.
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: There's likely to be Leithanian border patrol teams nearby, or possibly Siracusan cargo landships passing through. Watch out for them.
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: You made it through Chernobog and Lungmen. Avoiding them shouldn't be too difficult for you.
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: *sigh* Out of a team of thirty, I'm the last man standing...
attributes.name: Reunion Member

attributes.content: Why can't we just stay here, Crownslayer?
attributes.name: Reunion Member

attributes.content: If we stay together here, we'll just become targets for those in power. That or be forced to become cannon fodder again.
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: Since you guys didn't want to follow Nine, I'll be the one seeing you off.
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: This is the last thing I can do as Reunio—the last thing I can do for you.
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: But where will you go? You'd be on your own too, wouldn't you?
attributes.name: Reunion Member

attributes.content: I'll wander. I'll check on a few things. I'll think a bit.
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: Before I left Siracusa, my master told me not to go back to Ursus to seek revenge. I was too weak, and knew too little... But I didn't listen to her.
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: It might be time to return now. I'd like to see her again. Maybe she can give me some other suggestions... Ways for me to become stronger.
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: What's your master like?
attributes.name: Reunion Member

attributes.content: She's from one of the Siracusan famiglie. She was strong in battle, yet also one of the wisest people I knew. She taught me a lot.
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: Siracusa, eh? That's a long ways away.
attributes.name: Reunion Member

attributes.content: Look at this bonfire out here among the snow, friend. Once, it could ignite the anger of the Infected. It could spark the dream of Reunion. It could set all of Ursus ablaze.
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: But now, all it does is keep us warm.
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: Here's the last thing I have to say to you: Forget Talulah. Forget Chernobog. Forget Lungmen. Forget Reunion. Forget us. If you choose to leave, then leave it all behind you.
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: Hell, forget the crystals growing on your body. Maybe if you forget everything, you can go home.
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: *sigh*...
attributes.name: Reunion Member

attributes.content: Though we both chose to leave, I always felt you and I weren't alike...
attributes.name: Reunion Member

attributes.content: You look like you're the type of person who knows a lot, and you've read lots of books. At times, I feel like you, the Captain and Talulah are all pretty similar.
attributes.name: Reunion Member

attributes.content: *sigh*... I meant more like... When I was little, my grandpapa always said people who read too much were easily lead astray.
attributes.name: Reunion Member

attributes.content: Anyway... Never mind. See you later, Crownslayer. Best of luck to you. Looks like you're going to need it.
attributes.name: Reunion Member

attributes.content: We won't be seeing each other again, friend.
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: Ugh, my tail's all wet.
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: Nothing's changed at all. Neither these filthy streets, nor this damned rain.
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: Dunno what it is, but even though the snow in Ursus can kill people, the rain here's somehow more unpleasant.
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: Hope there's a hairdryer at my master's place...
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: Maestro!
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: The thick, inescapable stench of blood.
Her teacher lies face-up on the ground, fresh blood still flowing outward and spreading.
A small knife has been dropped nearby.
Lyudmila tries to approach and stifle her teacher's still-bleeding wound, but she finds herself unable to move a single step, unable to even tear away her gaze.
From the shadows wafts an aura that is both familiar and terrifying to her.
A wolf with gray hair, wearing a red hoodie.
The true wolf is dead. I did as Grandmother asked.
attributes.name: Projekt Red

attributes.content: It's you.
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: What... have you done?!
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: I am a wolf hunter. I do as Grandmother asks.
attributes.name: Projekt Red

attributes.content: The true wolf is dead. The true wolf did not fight.
attributes.name: Projekt Red

attributes.content: Why...
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: Why?
Why has this girl wearing a red hoodie chased after her, haunted her from Yan to Siracusa?
You...
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: Who the hell...
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: Who the hell are you?!
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: Lyudmila silently looks at the fire in front of her. It is a burning duffel bag, her master interred within.

She did not sleep at all that night. She thinks about how she used salt and water to scrub away the bloodstains in the room, how she dragged her master's corpse out into the wilds under the cover of the incessant rain.
She was stick-thin before she died. Lyudmilla barely had to exert herself.
Lyudmila never forgot how she met her master.
There was blood everywhere. Her uncle, her only living relative. His family. His servants. Their corpses strewn across the entire house.

The one who sent her to Siracusa told her that her uncle had control of the businesses on a couple of streets. Not a powerful man, per se, but in a small Siracusan town, it would be enough to let her live comfortably.
But before she could even get used to her new life... A simple Originium bomb smashed through the windows. In the chaos, her arm was gashed. She trembled in fear as she cowered under the bed.
There was no difference between the gangsters rushing into that house and the Ursus Guard charging into the lab. She felt like she was back in Chernobog, back in that night she lost her father.
Only when everything finally went quiet did Lyudmila dare to leave her room.
The gangsters, too, were lying down in pools of blood. The only ones alive in the house were her and the lowliest of her uncle's servants.

If memory served correctly, the servant was always living out by the gate, in charge of sending and receiving letters. The only time she would limp into the house was to deliver the mail to her masters.
She would always tiptoe across the carpet, so as to not make too loud a noise.

attributes.text: 'Another gang vendetta. Your uncle upset them. I'm about to head off... Do you have anywhere to go?'
'D-Did you kill all these bad guys?'
'If I didn't, you and I would both be dead.'
'Why didn't you save them when it all started?'
'I thought they were here for me... With this body of mine, I need to wait for them to get close before I can do anything.'
'You're scary... but also amazing. C-Can I go with you?'
'Do you want revenge? For your uncle? You weren't that close to him. And I remember that the one who sent you here wanted you to live a peaceful life... Well, I suppose that's not happening anymore.'
'Lyudmila, do you know what it means to be my student?'
'I've become decrepit and weak now. Are you still willing to be my student, and my tool?'
'We will both regret it, ragazza.'
'I won't. All you need to do is teach me. Teach me how to hold a knife, how to get my revenge. I won't regret it!'
'A knife? No, you're not ready for a knife just yet.'
'First, learn how to light a fire. Burn down this house and everything in it, so that nobody can find us.'
'Fire hides everything, Lyudmila.'

attributes.content: She chose to deal with her master's corpse using the very first trick she taught her.
But now what?
After leaving Reunion, she spent two years making her way back to Siracusa, all to lose the last home she could return to in barely a day...
The fire is extinguished, and the morning breeze blows away the last of the ashes. There is no trace of it left in the wilderness.
Where should you go next, Lyudmila?
I want... revenge.
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: Found you.
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: Hmm? Were you looking for me?
attributes.name: Projekt Red

attributes.content: It's not hard finding a killer from the outside in this city.
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: You stand out. A lot.
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: Don't block my way.
attributes.name: Projekt Red

attributes.content: Don't you dare think of running!
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: Hmph.
attributes.name: Projekt Red

attributes.content: Before we start, I've got a question for you. Why?
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: My master never mentioned an enemy like you. Why would someone hanging out with Kal'tsit know her?
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: The true wolf... must die.
attributes.name: Projekt Red

attributes.content: These are the rules of the game.
attributes.name: Projekt Red

attributes.content: What game?! What the hell are you talking about?!
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: I don't care who you are... You killed the last of my family, so I'll make you pay.
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: You're too weak. You can't beat me.
attributes.name: Projekt Red

attributes.content: Don't underestimate me!
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: You just managed to get a sneak attack off last time! Don't think you managed to scare me!
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: ...You're in my way.
attributes.name: Projekt Red

attributes.content: Stop following me.
attributes.name: Projekt Red

attributes.content: Get... Get back here!
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: I'm not letting you go...
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: Cazzo...!
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: An unfamiliar city... Unfamiliar food...
attributes.name: Projekt Red

attributes.content: It's strange, but it's fine.
attributes.name: Projekt Red

attributes.content: You've got quick reflexes, I'll give you that.
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: ...It's you again.
attributes.name: Projekt Red

attributes.content: Like I said, I'll make you pay.
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: Don't even think of escaping. Either kill me, or be killed by me. There's only two ways out of this.
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: (Bares teeth in irritation)
attributes.name: Projekt Red

attributes.content: Angry?
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: Good, show me what you've really got—
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: Hey! HEY!
attributes.name: Restaurant Owner

attributes.content: I don't care what famiglie you ragazze are with, you wanna fight, do it outside!
attributes.name: Restaurant Owner

attributes.content: There's a bad smell, and strange sounds.
attributes.name: Projekt Red

attributes.content: ...Danger.
attributes.name: Projekt Red

attributes.content: That strange person...
attributes.name: Projekt Red

attributes.content: You... How much longer are you going to follow me?
attributes.name: Projekt Red

attributes.content: I told you already. Until I kill you, or you kill me.
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: You've tried lots of times. You can't kill me.
attributes.name: Projekt Red

attributes.content: And now you're tired.
attributes.name: Projekt Red

attributes.content: Then... kill me... already.
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: The exhausted Reproba collapses onto the ground. Before she falls unconscious, she grabs on tight onto the red-clad Lupo's pants.
You... look really pathetic.
attributes.name: Projekt Red

attributes.content: Hey, hey! What happened? You alright?
attributes.name: Sommer

attributes.content: Get back here... Don't go...
attributes.name: Mumbling Voice

attributes.content: *sigh* My truck broke down, couldn't go even if I wanted to.
attributes.name: Sommer

attributes.content: Why're you lying down here? Are you hurt? Got anyone I can call?
attributes.name: Sommer

attributes.content: No... None...
attributes.name: Mumbling Voice

attributes.content: What did you say? Can't understand a word of that mumbling... Lemme get that mask off you, let you breathe a bit easier—
attributes.name: Sommer

attributes.content: Oh, wow... There's crystals in your mouth. That's a pretty serious infection...
attributes.name: Sommer

attributes.content: A homeless Infected, huh. *sigh* What am I to do with you?
attributes.name: Sommer

attributes.content: Man, the first time I decide to run a long-haul job for the association and this happens...
attributes.name: Sommer

attributes.content: Guess we're both out of luck.
attributes.name: Sommer

attributes.text: (The Unlucky)
